Add Lithology Descriptions or Remarks

Add horizontal lithology descriptions or remarks to a special text track.

Note. For more information on horizontal text tracks, click here.

Double click on text track. The Track Text Entry dialog box will open.

In the Horizontal text tab, enter the text.

Format the text,

Select a Background Color

Justification within the track

Text Margins – margin from the Left, Right, Top and Bottom of the track or box.

Add a box by selecting the Boxed Text, Yes check box. Define a Margin from the L and R of the track, Pen width and Color.

Font

Some lithology descriptions may not be placed at its correct depth due to space limitations. If the text needs to be exported, the Actual Depth Range can be specified in the Start and End box.

Select Apply and Close.

There are additional features in the Track Text Entry window which may not be required on a regular basis, but are explained by clicking herehere.

Display Text in Plot Mode - Choose to display the entry in specific plot modes by checking the TVD, TWT and VSEC boxes in the Display Text in Plot Mode. Clearing the check box will prevent the track text from appearing on the plot whenever that specific mode is enabled. It does not remove them from the ODF, simply from the display.

Text Weightage - Choose to display the text entry when the plot scale is compressed (for example a change from 1:500 to 1:2000). Enter a weight of 100 to ensure the text carries the maximum weight and will always display, irrespective of plot scale. If the weight is less than 100, the text will display only if the Cutoff Weight for Track Text (defined in Edit > Global Settings > Scale & Grid tab), is less than this specified weight.

Links - Add an external and/or internal link to the text. The link can provide additional or more detailed information. An example of an external link is a URL or Network location. An internal link could be using to associate the text with other GEO objects, such as a specification in the header or trailer.

To create or edit a link,

Click Links. The Create or Modify External and Internal Links for an Object will open.

Enter the desired URL in the External Link or click Browse to locate the local or network item.

For an Internal link, select the Header or Trailer then use the lists below to select in Layout and Header/Trailer.

Choose to identify links using a marker in the Link Object on Screen Display with Link Marker list.

Click OK.

For further information on managing Links, click here.
